meanings.definition: To bring back to life or consciousness.
meanings.sent1: The doctor worked hard to revive the patient after the accident.
meanings.sent2: I used CPR to revive the drowning swimmer at the pool.
meanings.sent3: The magical potion could revive even the sleepiest of animals.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a ray of sunshine, able to revive anyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The music had the power to revive memories of childhood summers.

meanings.definition: To restore to use, currency, or vigor.
meanings.sent1: The company hoped to revive its old marketing strategies for the new product.
meanings.sent2: The rain helped revive the dry, thirsty plants in the garden.
meanings.sent3: Adding some spices can revive the flavor of a bland dish.
meanings.sent4: A good night's sleep can revive your energy levels for the next day.
meanings.sent5: The motivational speaker's words were enough to revive the team's enthusiasm.

meanings.definition: To renew in the mind or memory.
meanings.sent1: Listening to the song helped revive my memories of our school days.
meanings.sent2: The old photograph album revived forgotten stories from the past.
meanings.sent3: A whiff of fresh-baked cookies can revive memories of grandma's kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The smell of the ocean always revives my longing for summer vacations.
meanings.sent5: The familiar scent of pine trees revived thoughts of winter holidays.
